title: The Archive
author: The Archive
content: Everything in this world does not happen by itself, there must be a creator. My deepest gratitude goes to Satoshi Nakamoto as the creator of Bitcoin and the biggest initiator behind Bitcoin's incredible achievements.There's something interesting for me to know from you about the Bitcoin journey. There are many stories that happened in Bitcoin's journey before it was famous as it is today that I know from search results on the internet, ranging from being underestimated to having no price.Anyone reading, please share what you've learned while getting to know Bitcoin. What is your reason behind Bitcoin's survival to this day and how do you thank Bitcoin. Finally, making something is very easy but maintaining it is very difficult.Let's share your experience as a form of support and love for Bitcoin.Get ready for Bitcoin's birthday.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: Did you hear or read about the origin of the world “hodl"? Today I saw a post on Facebook that the forum member was drunk when he wrote hodl instead of hold. Generally I learnt that mistakes go viral online. I'm not sure about his condition that day whether drunk or typos but, sharing ones thought at any moment, mood or condition can make a difference in the cryptocurrency market.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I made a thread some time ago with what I felt were 10 of the most classic Bitcointalk posts.  I'll link to it below.  It's not a bad place to start if you're wanting to learn more about what has gone on here over the years, especially the highlights.  Throughout the thread you'll find that other people have also listed some threads that they feel were important.  Feel free to add to their suggestions if you think there's been a thread that hasn't been represented.  Happy reading.  Enjoy! TEN CLASSIC Bitcointalk posts:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2822621.0

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: The Archive on October 29, 2022, 06:43:52 PM<...>Bitcoin has been a long road, one filled with its fair share of criticism and danger in the past. But now things are different. Bitcoin is slowly becoming mainstream and will make its mark on history as one of the most important inventions in modern times. It's also one of the most secure forms of payment available today, which makes it a great choice for those looking to protect their assets. The world is changing, and Bitcoin is at the forefront of this change, but Bitcoin's success is definitely due to its users. It's up to you whether you want to be a part of this change or not.

comments.author: suzanne5223
comments.body: There are many reasons why Bitcoin survives but the aspect of fud, the government's negative stance, and inflation. The major reason why Bitcoin survive is because of its decentralization, consensus, block halving, and no censorship.These are what I believe make the trust and confidence of crypto enthusiasts in Bitcoin stand strong and once crypto gains the trust of crypto enthusiasts it is easy for the coin to survive.

comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: I guess the timing of you entering the market could be good. The price is still very cheap and if your intention is to invest and make money and profit then you made the right now. I guess that is the first thing that you will get, financial freedom, meaning because of your investment on bitcoin, you will have a good cash flow and you can do whatever you want, buy things for your and for your family. So it's going to be a good experience for you down the line, invest and hold and then wait for the next bull run to enjoy your profit.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: To sum it all up, I learned what's beyond the price of Bitcoin. In a way, I'm proud to say that the reason why I bought my first Bitcoin is not anymore the same reason why I HODL them until today. That, for me, is good growth enough as far as understanding Bitcoin is concerned. That somehow signifies that my way of looking at Bitcoin has somehow matured so to speak.I guess the way to thank Bitcoin is to spread its awareness. But I have to admit that I'm not anymore as aggressive in talking about it as before. This is basically for security reasons and to avoid being wrongly judged. But I'm always more than willing to converse about it with somebody who is truly curious about it. I have very limited knowledge, though, so an exchange is certainly better than a lecture of some sort.

comments.author: Daltonik
comments.body: Skeptics about the value and usefulness of bitcoin were and still are now eight or nine years ago, I tried to tell my friends about it, but there was nothing but condescending ridicule. With the development of technology, the emergence of the bitcoin phenomenon was only a matter of time, and the further development goes, the more likely it is that something like this will appear in the future, when home quantum computers appear and development tools become available, I think the time will come for something like superpositioncoin.

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: Bitcoin remains something that took the world government by surprise. They never thought it would get would get foothold in the world of finance but like we have it now, it stood and there's hardly anything that could be done to stop it.Some of the greatest strength to bitcoin is how free it is and the privacy it gives its holders. Not mention, its the only truly decentralized cryptocurrency that is. Bitcoin has been ale to use the funds about it for its publicity and the more anti-cryptos and government tries to drag it to the mould, the more curious it makes people and when they find out what it truly is and the opportunities that exists there in, it calls for a freewill investment and an escape from centralized system.Satoshi Nakamoto made a first good step by not being the center of it all but lving it to freewill and the activities of evey holder to decide its future. It comes without greed or selfish interest.
